page.title: 03THE BOGS
page.content: The Bogs is a piece of land near the bridge over Scorton beck.The reason why the Bogs is called by that name is because it used to be swampy land,and it still is in parts. After the Green was levelled the people of Scorton used the Bogs as a rubbish tip. Then the Parish Council decided to have it all grassed over.Hundreds of tons of soil were brought from the Gatherley Road trading estate when the Cadbury's Smash factory was being built. On the Bogs there is a tree with a stone seat around it.They were given by the R.A.O.B.(the Buffs),and cost Â£200 in 1982.R.A.O.B.stands for the Royal Antidiluvian Order of the Buffaloes.
